greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiset transform of A011782, powers of 2: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, ...
comment: T(n,k) is the number of multisets of exactly k binary words with a total of n letters and each word beginning with 1. T(4,2) = 7: {1,100}, {1,101}, {1,110}, {1,111}, {10,10}, {10,11}, {11,11}. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 18 2017
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
Index entries for triangles generated by the Multiset Transformation
maple: b:= proc(n, i, p) option remember; `if`(p>n, 0, `if`(n=0, 1,
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..14);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 12 2017
mathematica: b[n_, i_, p_] := b[n, i, p] = If[p > n, 0, If[n == 0, 1, If[Min[i, p] < 1, 0, Sum[Binomial[2^(i - 1) + j - 1, j] b[n - i j, i - 1, p - j], {j, 0, Min[n/i, p]}]]]];
Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 07 2019, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Cf. A034691 (row sums), A000007 (column k=0), A011782 (column k=1), A178945(n-1) (column k=2).
The reverse of the n-th row converges to A034899.
results.author: _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 24 2017
